messages.content: This information pertains to the Scheme for Autonomous Program (With Effect from 2023-2024).
What is the examination scheme for the course ADC303?
For ADC303, Data Structure, the examination scheme includes 20 marks for internal assessment, 20 marks for term work, and 60 marks for the end semester exam.
How many contact hours are there for ADC304, Digital Logic & Computer Architecture?
ADC304 has 3 theory contact hours.
Is there a lab for ADC305, Computer Networks and Operating Systems?
Yes, there is a lab for ADC305.
Can you provide details about the teaching scheme for the course ADL301?
ADL301, Data Structure Lab, has 2 practical contact hours.
Thank you.
You're welcome!
This information pertains to Engineering Mathematics-III (ADC301).
What are the prerequisites for ADC301?
The prerequisites for ADC301 are Engineering Mathematics-I and Engineering Mathematics-II.
Can you explain the course objectives of ADC301?
The objectives include building a strong foundation in mathematics and preparing students for multi-disciplinary projects.
What are the learning outcomes of ADC301?
Upon completion, students will be able to apply Laplace transform, solve Fourier series, and evaluate complex variable functions, among other skills.
How many contact hours does ADC301 have?
ADC301 has 8 hours of teaching for Laplace Transform and 6 hours for Inverse Laplace Transform.
What is the term work evaluation for ADC301?
The term work assessment includes tutorials, assignments, viva, and mini-projects based on the syllabus.
Thank you.
You're welcome!
This information pertains to Discrete Structures and Graph Theory (ADC302).
What are the course objectives of ADC302?
The objectives include cultivating clear thinking, understanding mathematical proofs, and applying graph theory to solve practical problems.
What are the learning outcomes of ADC302?
Upon completion, students will be able to reason logically, understand relations and functions, and analyze complex computing problems using discrete mathematics principles.
How many contact hours does ADC302 have?
ADC302 has 6 hours of teaching for Logic and 6 hours for Relations and Functions.
What is the term work evaluation for ADC302?
The term work assessment includes tutorials, assignments, and group discussions, among other activities.
Thank you.
You're welcome!
This information pertains to Data Structure (ADC303).
What are the prerequisites for ADC303?
The prerequisite for ADC303 is knowledge of C Programming.
What are the course objectives of ADC303?
The objectives include understanding the significance of data structures, implementing linear and nonlinear data structures, and selecting appropriate structures for real-world problems.
What are the learning outcomes of ADC303?
Upon completion, students will be able to implement various data structures, handle operations like searching and insertion, and choose appropriate structures for problem-solving.
How many contact hours does ADC303 have?
ADC303 has 8 hours of teaching for Stack and Queues and 10 hours for Linked List.
What is the term work evaluation for ADC303?
The term work assessment includes tutorials, assignments, and mini-projects based on the syllabus.
Thank you.
You're welcome!
This information pertains to Digital Logic & Computer Organization and Architecture (ADC304).
What are the prerequisites for ADC304?
The prerequisite for ADC304 is knowledge of number systems.
What are the course objectives of ADC304?
The objectives include understanding basic digital circuits, arithmetic operations, control signal generation, and memory organization.
What are the learning outcomes of ADC304?
Upon completion, students will be able to demonstrate arithmetic algorithms, understand digital components, and describe memory organization, among other skills.
How many contact hours does ADC304 have?
ADC304 has 6 hours of teaching for Computer Fundamentals and 8 hours for Data Representation and Arithmetic algorithms.
What is the term work evaluation for ADC304?
The term work assessment includes tutorials, assignments, and mini-projects based on the syllabus.
Thank you.
You're welcome!
This information pertains to Computer Networks and Operating Systems (ADC305).
What are the objectives of ADC305?
The objectives include introducing basic concepts of operating systems, understanding process management, and exploring computer networks and OSI layers.
What are the learning outcomes of ADC305?
Upon completion, students will understand OS structures, analyze process management, and explain networking concepts and protocols.
How many contact hours does ADC305 have?
ADC305 has 8 hours of teaching for Process and Process Scheduling and 7 hours for Physical, Data Link Layer, and Network Layer.
What is the term work evaluation for ADC305?
The term work assessment includes practical exams based on the syllabus and continuous assessment through experiments.
Thank you for the information.
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
This information pertains to Data Structures Lab (ADL301).
What are the objectives of ADL301?
The objectives include implementing basic data structures, solving problems involving graphs and trees, and developing applications using data structure algorithms.
What are the learning outcomes of ADL301?
Students will be able to implement various data structures, handle operations like insertion and deletion, and apply them to solve problems.
What experiments are suggested for ADL301?
Experiments include implementing Stack ADT using arrays, converting infix to postfix expressions, and implementing various linked list ADTs.
How is the term work evaluated for ADL301?
Term work consists of practical exams based on syllabus and evaluation of experiments, totaling 25 marks.
Thank you!
No problem! Let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with.
This information pertains to Digital Logic & Computer Organization and Architecture Lab (ADL302).
What are the objectives of ADL302?
The objectives include implementing arithmetic unit operations, designing digital circuits, and demonstrating CPU and ALU designs.
How many experiments are suggested for ADL302?
There are 16 experiments suggested, covering topics like logic gates, arithmetic circuits, and CPU and memory design.
How is the term work evaluated for ADL302?
Term work is evaluated based on satisfactory performance in laboratory work and obtaining minimum passing marks, with a total of 25 marks based on experiment evaluation.
What is the evaluation exam structure for ADL302?
The evaluation includes a practical exam based on the syllabus of ADL302 and ADC305.
Thanks!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
This information pertains to Computer Networks and Operating Systems Lab (ADL303).
What are the objectives of ADL303?
The objectives include gaining practical experience with operating system concepts, developing skills in Linux environment, and understanding network protocols.
How many experiments are suggested for ADL303?
There are 12 suggested experiments covering Linux commands, shell scripting, process management, and network design.
How is the term work evaluated for ADL303?
Term work is evaluated based on satisfactory performance in laboratory work and obtaining minimum passing marks, with a total of 25 marks based on experiment evaluation.
What is the evaluation exam structure for ADL303?
The evaluation includes a practical exam based on the syllabus of ADL303 and ADC305.
Thank you!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
This information pertains to the Object Oriented Programming with Java Lab (ADL304).
What are the objectives of ADL304?
The objectives include learning object-oriented programming concepts, studying Java programming language, and understanding GUI-based programming.
How is the term work evaluated for ADL304?
Term work consists of 15 experiments and a mini project, with a total of 50 marks based on evaluation.
What is the evaluation exam structure for ADL304?
The evaluation includes a practical exam based on the syllabus of ADL304, with students performing 5 assignments or experiments.
Thank you!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
This information pertains to the Mobile Application Development Lab (ADS301).
What are the objectives of ADS301?
The objectives include learning Dart Programming Language, Flutter framework, and developing interactive Flutter apps.
How is the term work evaluated for ADS301?
Term work consists of 5 assignments, activities, or experiments, with a total of 50 marks based on evaluation.
What is the evaluation exam structure for ADS301?
The evaluation includes assessing the performance in the suggested assignments, activities, or experiments.
Got it, thanks!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need assistance, feel free to ask.
